data.title: Frederic Passy
data.meta_description: Sold for $245 | French economist (1822–1912) and a joint winner (together with Henry Dunant) of the first Nobel Peace Prize awarded in 1901. ALS in
data.text: French economist (1822–1912) and a joint winner (together with Henry Dunant) of the first Nobel Peace Prize awarded in 1901. ALS in French, three pages on two adjoining sheets, 4 x 5.25, October 8, 1858. Untranslated letter regarding the elections and voting in the International and Permanent League of Peace, which he had founded. In fine condition. RR Auction COA.
